text: The Kosovo women's national football team (, /Ženska fudbalska reprezentacija Kosova) represents Kosovo in international women's football and is controlled by the Football Federation of Kosovo. ==History== In 2010, the national team is established. On 6 February 2013, FIFA gave the permission to play international friendly games against other member associations. On 3 May 2016 at the UEFA Congress in Budapest, Kosovo were accepted into UEFA after members voted 28–24 in favor of Kosovo. ==Home stadium== The Kosovo women's national football team play their home matches on the Adem Jashari Olympic Stadium. ==Achievements== On 1 March 2017. Kosovo played its first international match as FIFA member, in the framework of a tournament against Poland. The match ended in a 0–5 defeat. On 9 January 2017, the national team for the first time was able to enter tournaments organized by FIFA and will play their first competitive matches in the qualification rounds for the 2019 FIFA Women's World Cup. ===World Cup record=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" !colspan=9|FIFA Women's World Cup record !rowspan=8| !colspan=9|Qualification record |- !Year !Round !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| |- |1995 to 1999 |colspan=8|Part of Yugoslavia/Serbia and Montenegro||colspan=8|— |- |2003 to 2007 |colspan=8|Team did not exist || colspan=8|— |- |2011 to 2015 |colspan=8|Not a FIFA member || colspan=8|Not a FIFA member |- | 2019 |colspan=8|Did not qualify||3||0||0||3||3||12 |- | 2023 |colspan=8|To be determined||—||—||—||—||—||— |- !Total !— !0/9 !0 !0 !0 !0 !0 !0 !3 !0 !0 !3 !3 !12 |} ===UEFA Women's Championship record=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" !colspan=9|UEFA Women's Championship record !rowspan=10| !colspan=9|Qualification record |- !Year !Round !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| !width=28| |- |1993 to 1997 |colspan=8|Part of Yugoslavia/Serbia and Montenegro||colspan=8|— |- |2001 to 2009 |colspan=8|Team did not exist || colspan=8|— |- | 2013 |colspan=8|Not a UEFA member || colspan=8|Not a UEFA member |- | 2017 |colspan=8|Could not enter||colspan=7|— |- | 2021 |colspan=8|To be determined |6||3||0||3||6||14 |- !Total !— !0/13 !0 !0 !0 !0 !0 !0 !6 !3 !0 !3 !6 !14 |} ===Non-FIFA tournament record=== In 2017. Kosovo was invited for first time to the Turkish Women's Cup. They were sorted into a group with Poland, Romania and Turkey and ended the last with 3 defeats. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Year !Round ! ! ! ! ! ! !width="28"|Squad |- | 2017 |rowspan="2"|Group stage |3||0||0||3||2||12|| |- | 2018 |4||1||1||2||2||9||Squad |- !Total !2/2 !7 !1 !1 !5 !4 !21 !— |} ==Honours== ==Coaching staff== {| class="wikitable" width=40% style="text-align:left;font-size:100%;" |- !Position !Name |- |Head coach | Afërdita Fazlija |- |rowspan="3"|Assistant coach(es) |- | Sanije Krasniqi |- | Veton Çitaku |- |Goalkeeping coach | Besart Ismajli |- |rowspan="3"|Physiotherapist(s) |- | Filloretë Berisha |- | Sabit Hajra |- |Doctor | Enver Hoxha |- |Device manager | Taulant Ahmetaj |} ==Players== ===Current squad=== The following players were called up for the UEFA Women's Euro 2021 qualifying match against Estonia, on 18 September 2020. All caps and goals as of 18 September 2020 after match against Estonia, only matches as FIFA member are included. ===Recent call-ups=== The following players have been called up for the team within the last 12 months and are still available for selection. ;Notes *PRE = Preliminary squad. *CLUB = It is not part of the current squad after the club has not allowed her to join. *EDU = It is not part of the current squad due to school exam obligations. ===Previous squads=== ===Individual records=== **Active players in bold, statistics correct as of 2020. ===Most capped players=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !width=|# !width=|Player !width=|Year(s) !width=|Caps |} ===Top goalscorers=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !width =|# !width =|Player !width =|Year(s) !width =|Goals !width =|Caps |} ==Managers== * Afërdita Fazlija (–present) ==Results and fixtures== The following is a list of match results in the last 12 months, as well as any future matches that have been scheduled. ===2019=== ===2020=== ==Head-to-head records against other countries== Head-to-head records are included only matches as FIFA member. {| class="sortable wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- !Opponent ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! |- |style="text-align:left;"| |- |style="text- align:left;"| |- |style="text-align:left;"| |- |style="text-align:left;"| |- |style="text-align:left;"| |- |style="text-align:left;"| |- |style="text- align:left;"| |- |style="text-align:left;"| |- |style="text-align:left;"| |- |style="text-align:left;"| |- |style="text-align:left;"| |- |style="text- align:left;"| |- |style="text-align:left;"| |- |style="text-align:left;"| |- |style="text-align:left;"| |- class="sortbottom" !13 Countries |} ==See also== ;Men's *National team *Under-21 *Under-19 *Under-17 *Futsal ;Women's *Under-19 ==Notes and references== ===Notes=== ===References=== ==External links== * *Kosovo (women) News about the team Category:European women's national association football teams
